articles.headline: Defying Trump, U.N. General Assembly Condemns U.S. Decree on Jerusalem
articles.snippet: The vote amounted to a collective act of defiance toward the Trump administration at the United Nations, the world’s biggest diplomatic stage.
articles.abstract: The vote amounted to a collective act of defiance toward the Trump administration at the United Nations, the world’s biggest diplomatic stage.
articles.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — A lopsided majority of United Nations members rebuked the United States on Thursday, denouncing its decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israel’s capital and ignoring President Trump’s threats to retaliate by cutting aid to countries voting against it.
articles.byline: By Rick Gladstone and Mark Landler

articles.headline: Holiday Windows Brighten a Bleak Retail Scene, but How Long Will They Last?
articles.snippet: Christmas windows at department stores still have allure, but much less so in the age of e-commerce and big box stores like Walmart.
articles.abstract: Christmas windows at department stores still have allure, but much less so in the age of e-commerce and big box stores like Walmart.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of my fondest childhood memories is of my family’s annual holiday trip to St. Louis to see the department store windows. I was transfixed by the corner window at Famous-Barr, where model trains wound their way through a labyrinth of tunnels and bridges in a snow-covered mountain landscape.

articles.headline: A Cute Toy Just Brought a Hacker Into Your Home
articles.snippet: Amid the holiday shopping season, cybersecurity researchers warn that new, interactive toys are vulnerable to many hacking threats.
articles.abstract: Amid the holiday shopping season, cybersecurity researchers warn that new, interactive toys are vulnerable to many hacking threats.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — My Friend Cayla, a doll with nearly waist-length golden hair that talks and responds to children’s questions, was designed to bring delight to households. But there’s something else that Cayla might bring into homes as well: hackers and identity thieves.

articles.headline: Obamacare Sign-ups at High Levels Despite Trump Saying It’s ‘Imploding’
articles.snippet: Sign-ups at Healthcare.gov reached 8.8 million, just shy of last year’s levels, despite an open enrollment period that was half as long and far less advertised.
articles.abstract: Sign-ups at Healthcare.gov reached 8.8 million, just shy of last year’s levels, despite an open enrollment period that was half as long and far less advertised.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration said Thursday that 8.8 million people had signed up for health insurance through the Affordable Care Act’s federal marketplace, a surprisingly large number only slightly lower than the total in the last open enrollment period, which was twice as long and heavily advertised.

articles.headline: Eric Schmidt to Step Down as Alphabet’s Executive Chairman
articles.snippet: Mr. Schmidt, who has been in a top position at Google and then its parent company, Alphabet, since 2001, will become a technical adviser to the company.
articles.abstract: Mr. Schmidt, who has been in a top position at Google and then its parent company, Alphabet, since 2001, will become a technical adviser to the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Eric Schmidt joined Google in 2001 to provide what amounted to adult supervision for the company’s young founders, Larry Page and Sergey Brin. He helped take Google public in 2004 and built it into a colossus. In 2011, after being appointed executive chairman, he became a prominent emissary for the company to Washington.
articles.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi, Katie Benner and Claire Cain Miller

articles.headline: Trump Promised to Protect Steel. Layoffs Are Coming Instead.
articles.snippet: Steelworkers thought they would see a new dawn for their industry. But the president’s pledge to do something has actually done more harm than good.
articles.abstract: Steelworkers thought they would see a new dawn for their industry. But the president’s pledge to do something has actually done more harm than good.
articles.lead_paragraph: CONSHOHOCKEN, Pa. — At this sprawling steel mill on the outskirts of Philadelphia, the workers have one number in mind. Not how many tons of steel roll off the line, or how many hours they work, but where they fall on the plant’s seniority list.

articles.headline: Bitcoin Plummets More Than 30 Percent in Less Than a Day
articles.snippet: Just days after the price of Bitcoin nearly reached $20,000, the virtual currency was hit by a panicked sell-off. Reddit users posted suicide hotlines.
articles.abstract: Just days after the price of Bitcoin nearly reached $20,000, the virtual currency was hit by a panicked sell-off. Reddit users posted suicide hotlines.
articles.lead_paragraph: You can’t exactly say that Bitcoin was burning a hole in anyone’s pocket, but the virtual currency burned a hole in quite a few hearts on Friday when it plunged 30 percent in less than 24 hours after defying gravity for the past few months.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Tiffany Hsu

articles.headline: What Happens When the Richest U.S. Cities Turn to the World?
articles.snippet: As the economy has changed, so have the relationships between places, to the disadvantage of smaller cities and rural areas.
articles.abstract: As the economy has changed, so have the relationships between places, to the disadvantage of smaller cities and rural areas.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Well before anyone thought of this place as the center of the tech economy, the Bay Area built ships. And it did so with the help of many parts of the country.
